group_1.textRight: ...So, this means the Tomorrow Shop isn't@going out of business then, right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, that's right.
Well, since the land on which I found the pot of gold belongs to the landlady,
I contacted her, and asked the police to bear@witness as well.
Since I was able to provide the proof that there@wasn't anything funny about it,
We all came to an agreement that it would be transfered to me as an inheritance.

group_1.textRight: ...So, that's what the attorney's office is taking@care of, huh?

group_1.textLeft: That's right.  Well, the inheritance procedure,@the tax collection, and all that.
...Converting the coins to currency, purchasing@the land and the building...
There are all kinds of troublesome formalities to go through.
It's enough to drive one crazy!
The landlady said she can wait a bit for it all to go through, though.
...Really!  It's hard to find the words to describe@all of this.
Something like this might be called a miracle,@don't you think?

group_1.textRight: I just wanna say how happy I am for you, Grams!

group_1.textLeft: Truly, thank you.

group_1.textRight: By the way, that map is still at the City University's library.
You can probably get it back if you explain the@situation.

group_1.textLeft: Is that right?@Perhaps I will go there soon.
...So yeah.
It's just like you said:@The Tomorrow Shop didn't go out of business.

group_1.textRight: I told you so, didn't I?@That it would be no problem.

group_1.textLeft: In other words, the fact that Grams found her husband's pot of gold was...

group_1.textRight: There's no doubt about it.  It was the miracle that resulted from your wish.

group_1.textLeft: Huh...
Hey, Kyubey.
[se:7201_detect_magic][chara:305101:effect_ef_adv_01]...?!
I know.@Looks like I'm up to bat, right?
In exchange for having my wish granted, I have to@fight witches as a Magical Girl...
I'll hold up my end of the bargain, without fail!
